thread.title: Lenovo launches Vibe Shot with 16MP camera, priced at Rs 25,499
thread.title_full: Lenovo launches Vibe Shot with 16MP camera, priced at Rs 25,499 - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Lenovo launches Vibe Shot with 16MP camera, priced at Rs 25,499
text:
NEW DELHI: After a slew of budget handsets, Lenovo has launched the camera-centric Vibe Shot smartphone at Rs 25,499 in the Indian market. The smartphone, which has a 16MP rear camera and 8MP front camera, will be up for preorder on Lenovo's e-commerce site TheDoStore.com starting 6pm on September 22. It will be available for sale in offline stores in the next two weeks, the company said.

Lenovo Vibe Shot full specs 

At Rs 25,499, the chief competitors of Lenovo Vibe Shot are OnePlus 2, Asus Zenfone 2 Deluxe, Samsung Galaxy A7 and Sony Xperia C5 Ultra. Motorola, which is owned by Lenovo, recently released its own camera-focussed smartphone Moto X Play in the Indian market at starting price of Rs 18,499.

Lenovo Vibe Shot has been designed to look similar to a compact camera. It has a 5-inch full-HD (1080x1920p) IPS display with Gorilla Glass protection.

READ ALSO:
Lenovo Vibe Shot first impressions 

The smartphone's 16MP rear camera has a 16:9 BSI sensor and tricolour flash, along with Optical Image Stabilization. The phone sports an infrared focus sensor which, as per the company, is twice as fast as normal autofocus. It supports 1080p video capture. The device also sports an 8MP front-facing camera for selfies.

Lenovo Vibe Shot is powered by a 1.7GHz Qualcomm Snapdragon 615 octa-core processor with 3GB RAM and 32GB internal storage. There's no memory card slot.

The phone is backed by a 2,900mAh battery and supports 4G LTE, 3G, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth 4.1 LE options. It runs Android 5.1 Lollipop with Lenovo's Vibe UI running on top.
